                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           Subject:  DSC-III- Organic Synthesis & Mechanism                                                                         NaN
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     Credit: 04(T) + 02 (P)                                                    Total learning hours: 60
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             Course description:   This course paper is about organic reaction mechanisms, which are extremely\ruseful in predicting the products and improving the reaction efficiency. Rearrangement, Methods of\rdetermining mechanism, Oxidation, Reduction, Chirality and Aromaticity. This course paper is about organic reaction mechanisms, which are extremely
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     seful in predicting the products and improving the reaction efficiency. Rearrangement,                                                                         NaN
Student learning outcome:\rAt the end of the course students will be able to learn...about\r•\rRearrangement reaction to electron deficient carbon, nitrogen, oxygen and electron rich\rcarbon atom.\r•\rName reaction, its mechanism and application.\r•\rAromaticity in benzenoid and non-benzenoid compounds.\r•\rKinetic and non-kinetic methods used for determination of reaction mechanism.\r•\rChirality in an organic compound,\r•\rDraw stereoisomers in the 3-dimensional conventions & determining absolute configuration.\r•\rOxidation and reduction with different reagents. Course description:\rThe course will\rcoverthediversityof naturalproducts and\rtheirrolesinbiologicalsystems,\rthe chemistry and\rbiosynthesisofthemajor natural\rproductclasses andthesynthesisof\rimportant natural products.\rThe study-unit will expose students to the field of natural product chemistry with emphasis on\rdifferent classes of natural products including carbohydrates, proteins, terpenes and lipids. During\rthe study-unit, the discussion will focus on the occurrence, structure and chemical synthesis the\rnatural products. The study-unit will, in addition, give an understanding of the use of natural\rproducts as starting materials in organic reactions.

                          Student learning outcome:\rAt the end of the course students will be able to...\rLearn the different types of alkaloids, glycosides & terpenes etc and their chemistry and medicinal\rimportance\r•\rExplain the importance of natural compounds as lead molecules for new drug discovery\r•\rExplain vitamins Chemistry and Physiological significance of Vitamin\r•\rElaborate general methods of structural elucidation of compounds of natural origin.\r•\rLearn advanced methods of structural elucidation of compounds of natural origin.\r•\rUnderstand isolation, purification and characterization of simple chemical constituents from\rthe natural sources                      NaN

5.1.4                                                Vitamins of K-group
  5.2       Biological functions of vitamin B1, B2, B6, folic acid, B12,
  NaN                    C, D1, E (α-tocopherol), K1, K2, H (β- biotin).
  5.3                                                       Synthesis of
5.3.1 Vitamin B1 including synthesis of pyrimidine and thiazole moieties
5.3.2               Vitamin B2 from 3, 4-dimethylaniline and D (-)ribose
5.3.3       Vitamin B6 from: 1) Ethoxy acetylacetone and cyano acetamide

Program: M.Sc. Organic Chemistry             Type: Theory
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Semester: II                      NaN
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             Subject:  DSE-II- Forensic Chemistry & Toxicology                      NaN
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Credit: 04(T) + 02 (P) Total learning hours: 60
Course description:  This course paper intends to deal about the Forensic Toxicology, the branch\rof science that applies the principles and knowledge of toxicology to issues and problems in the\rfield of law. To achieve this, techniques of analytical chemistry are combined with principles of\rtoxicology to address issues related to the toxic effects of substances on humans that are germane to\rjudicial proceedings. Analytical chemistry deals with the techniques and methods for determining\rthe identity and relative amounts of unknown components in a sample of matter.                      NaN
                                                                                                                                                                                                                             Student learning outcome:\rAt the end of the course students will be able to learn...\r•\rForensic chemistry and its scope,\r•\rExamination of petroleum products, fires, explosives,\r•\rTypes of forensic toxicology, analysis, extraction, isolation and clean up procedures,\r•\rForensic examination of metallic poison and various organic-toxic compounds.                      NaN
